snippet: More than a week after Hurricane Sandy, Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods.
abstract: Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of the families of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods as recovery from Hurricane Sandy continues; only one block in the village of 1,700 homes has had power and heat restored.
lead_paragraph: More than a week after Hurricane Sandy, Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods.

headline.seo: Gerritsen Beach, Home to Emergency Workers, Is Still Reeling From the Storm
headline.main: Neighborhood That Emergency Workers Call Home Is Still Reeling From Storm
headline.print_headline: Neighborhood That Emergency Workers Call Home Is Still Reeling From Storm
